segment.source: Flashing tools
segment.target: Flashing tools

segment.source: Flashing tools
segment.target: Flashing tools

segment.source: Flashing tools
segment.target: Flashing tools

segment.source: Each manufacturer has different techniques and tooling that they will use to manufacture and service a Windows 10 Mobile device.
segment.target: Each manufacturer has different techniques and tooling that they will use to manufacture and service a Windows 10 Mobile device.

segment.source: The best technical expertise regarding manufacturing resides within those who built the OEM manufacturing line.
segment.target: The best technical expertise regarding manufacturing resides within those who built the OEM manufacturing line.

segment.source: This means that the OEM will need to determine which flashing and manufacturing process will work best for them.
segment.target: This means that the OEM will need to determine which flashing and manufacturing process will work best for them.

segment.source: OEM service centers may have unique needs that will also influence the selection of flashing tools.
segment.target: OEM service centers may have unique needs that will also influence the selection of flashing tools.

segment.source: The OEM will need to determine how to test and validate that the selected tools and processes meets their cost, quality, and other unique manufacturing objectives.
segment.target: The OEM will need to determine how to test and validate that the selected tools and processes meets their cost, quality, and other unique manufacturing objectives.

segment.source: The OEM uses the Microsoft supplied imaging tools to create the FFU OS images that are flashed to the device.
segment.target: The OEM uses the Microsoft supplied imaging tools to create the FFU OS images that are flashed to the device.

segment.source: Flashing tools comparison
segment.target: Flashing tools comparison

segment.source: The OEM may need to develop a custom flashing tool to address the life cycle needs of the device.
segment.target: The OEM may need to develop a custom flashing tool to address the life cycle needs of the device.

segment.source: Other flashing options have limitations that the OEM should understand before deciding to use them.
segment.target: Other flashing options have limitations that the OEM should understand before deciding to use them.

segment.source: The following table summarizes the flashing tool options.
segment.target: The following table summarizes the flashing tool options.

segment.source: Scenario
segment.target: Scenario

segment.target: SoC Provided Manufacturing Flashing tool

segment.source: OEM custom flashing tool
segment.target: OEM custom flashing tool

segment.source: To create a flashing tool for manufacturing, the OEM must develop their own tools customized to their manufacturing environment and equipment.
segment.target: To create a flashing tool for manufacturing, the OEM must develop their own tools customized to their manufacturing environment and equipment.

segment.source: Depending on the OEMs requirements, the flashing tools may also need to address a number of scenarios described in Field service scenarios.
segment.target: Depending on the OEMs requirements, the flashing tools may also need to address a number of scenarios described in Field service scenarios.

segment.source: For more info, see Developing custom OEM flashing tools.
segment.target: For more info, see Developing custom OEM flashing tools.

segment.source: SoC provided manufacturing flashing tool
segment.target: SoC provided manufacturing flashing tool

segment.source: For information on the SoC provided manufacturing flashing tools, contact the SoC provider.
segment.target: For information on the SoC provided manufacturing flashing tools, contact the SoC provider.

segment.source: Gang programmer
segment.target: Gang programmer

segment.source: There are a number of options available to the OEM to flash binary images.
segment.target: There are a number of options available to the OEM to flash binary images.

segment.source: The OEM can use their unique flashing tools as well as gang programmer technologies to manufacture the device if they find that those options are more suitable to their environment.
segment.target: The OEM can use their unique flashing tools as well as gang programmer technologies to manufacture the device if they find that those options are more suitable to their environment.

segment.source: If the OEM uses a gang programmer they will need to develop a custom tool to convert the FFU image to a raw binary image.
segment.target: If the OEM uses a gang programmer they will need to develop a custom tool to convert the FFU image to a raw binary image.

segment.source: The conversion tool will need to:
segment.target: The conversion tool will need to:

segment.source: Open a raw binary file in the format expected by the gang programmer.
segment.target: Open a raw binary file in the format expected by the gang programmer.

segment.source: Read in the FFU file and parse the file data as specified in FFU image format.
segment.target: Read in the FFU file and parse the file data as specified in FFU image format.

segment.source: Write out the data referenced in the FFU BLOCKDATAENTRY elements to the raw file.
segment.target: Write out the data referenced in the FFU BLOCKDATAENTRY elements to the raw file.

segment.source: When there are no more entries, write out any metadata or padding needed for the raw format and then close the raw binary file.
segment.target: When there are no more entries, write out any metadata or padding needed for the raw format and then close the raw binary file.

segment.source: FFUTool support limitations
segment.target: FFUTool support limitations

segment.source: The Microsoft provided FFUTool full flash update (FFU) technology is designed for engineering development, and testing purposes; it is not supported for use in manufacturing.
segment.target: The Microsoft provided FFUTool full flash update (FFU) technology is designed for engineering development, and testing purposes; it is not supported for use in manufacturing.

segment.source: Each OEM must determine if the FFUTool is suitable for use in their service center environments.
segment.target: Each OEM must determine if the FFUTool is suitable for use in their service center environments.

segment.source: FFUTool known issues
segment.target: FFUTool known issues

segment.source: Using the FFUTool has a number of significant limitations that are summarized here.
segment.target: Using the FFUTool has a number of significant limitations that are summarized here.

segment.source: USB hub activity may cause flashing failures
segment.target: USB hub activity may cause flashing failures

segment.source: Some USB hubs have been known to cause reliability issues even when flashing devices in serial due to hardware interference to the streaming FFU data.
segment.target: Some USB hubs have been known to cause reliability issues even when flashing devices in serial due to hardware interference to the streaming FFU data.

segment.source: Multiple devices that share a single USB hub cannot be connected and disconnected while other connected device are flashing.
segment.target: Multiple devices that share a single USB hub cannot be connected and disconnected while other connected device are flashing.

segment.source: This uncovers a known hardware issue with some USB controllers.
segment.target: This uncovers a known hardware issue with some USB controllers.

segment.source: For more info, see KB908673.
segment.target: For more info, see KB908673.

segment.source: You should not unplug USB devices when device flashing is underway.
segment.target: You should not unplug USB devices when device flashing is underway.

segment.source: USB cable length is limited to 3 feet
segment.target: USB cable length is limited to 3 feet

segment.source: Flashing may be less reliable when using USB cables longer than 3 feet (.91 meters), or if your flashing setup contains consecutive cables that total to more than 3 feet.
segment.target: Flashing may be less reliable when using USB cables longer than 3 feet (.91 meters), or if your flashing setup contains consecutive cables that total to more than 3 feet.

segment.source: This is due to hardware limitations of data transfer in longer cables.
segment.target: This is due to hardware limitations of data transfer in longer cables.

segment.source: Flashing time per phone
segment.target: Flashing time per phone

segment.source: You will need to evaluate whether the flashing time per device meets their objectives for your manufacturing line.
segment.target: You will need to evaluate whether the flashing time per device meets their objectives for your manufacturing line.
